action.action-desc: Mr. Moulton introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to expand the eligibility of employees of the Department of Veterans Affairs to participate in the Education Debt Reduction Program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Retain Act.

section.header: Expansion of eligibility to participate in Education Debt Reduction Program
section.text: Subsection (a) of section 7682 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: An individual is eligible to participate in the Education Debt Reduction Program if the individual—

clause.text: is an employee in the Veterans Health Administration serving in a position (as determined by the Secretary) providing direct-patient care services or services incident to direct-patient care services for which recruitment or retention of qualified health-care personnel (as so determined) is difficult; or
is an employee in the Veterans Health Administration not covered by clause (i) serving in a position specified in section 7401 of this title; and

subparagraph.text: owes any amount of principal or interest under a loan, the proceeds of which were used by or on behalf of that individual to pay costs relating to a course of education or training which led to a degree that qualified the individual for the position referred to in clause (i) or (ii) of subparagraph (A).

paragraph.text: In selecting individuals to participate in the Education Debt Reduction Program, the Secretary shall give priority to individuals described in paragraph (1)(A)(i).
